meanings.definition: A smaller interval within a larger interval.
meanings.sent1: In music, a subinterval can be a short part of a longer song.
meanings.sent2: The subinterval between 1 and 5 on the number line is 4.
meanings.sent3: During the game, the subinterval of time for each turn was only 30 seconds.
meanings.sent4: The subinterval of silence in the concert was so brief that it felt like a heartbeat.
meanings.sent5: She measured the subinterval of the rope with precision, ensuring it was just right.

meanings.definition: A segment of a larger interval.
meanings.sent1: The subinterval of the marathon route passed through the scenic park.
meanings.sent2: He divided the journey into subintervals to make it more manageable.
meanings.sent3: The subinterval of the movie that made everyone laugh was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The subinterval of the painting with vibrant colors stood out from the rest.
meanings.sent5: She marked each subinterval of the recipe with colorful tabs for easy reference.
